page.title: 18Salhouse Equestrian Centre 2
page.content:
A Day at the Centre {******************* A typical day begins at 7.30a.m. with filling the haynets, mucking out the stables, feeding and watering the horses and then brushing and grooming them.The horses' tack is then put on ready for riding at 10a.m.There is a lecture at 11a.m. and then after lunch (12.00-1.00p.m.) it's down to grooming the horses again, cleaning the yard and cleaning the tack.The day ends after final watering and feeding of the horses at about 9.15p.m.
report by Michaela Allison and Alyson Clarke
